data_structures: set (implicitly for visited, though grid modification serves this)
algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) starting from all rotten oranges simultaneously.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum time for all fresh oranges to rot, spreading from rotten ones.
problem_summary_technical: Apply BFS on a grid to find the shortest time for all '1's to become '2's, starting from initial '2's.
key_insights: BFS is ideal for finding the shortest path/time in unweighted graphs (grid cells).
Simultaneous BFS from all initial rotten oranges correctly models the spreading process.
Tracking the time/level in BFS is crucial to determine the total minutes.
